To begin, the variants are all participial forms of the same verb. The key seems to be the perceived referent or antecedent of the participle. Is it â€œthe Jewsâ€, â€œthe Sanhedrinâ€ or â€œthe commanderâ€? The best answer from the point of view of the grammar is evidently â€œthe Jewsâ€, which would require a masc., nom., plural formâ€”the only candidate is variant 1). Variant 3), being genitive, is really strange, unless somehow someone thought that the commander intended to inquire of the Sanhedrin, viewed as plural.
